lines.text: Tomorrow, you'll stay home, You'll complete everyone of your missing assignments.
Tomorrow's Saturday.

[Yelling]
Good! Then you'll have the weekend to finish it. And if you ever, ever raise your hand to anyone in this family again, I'll call the police.
The police?
Yes.
What are they gonna do?
I hope you'll never have to find out.

00 A.M. and Deena's father is sitting on the stairwell]
Do I have to lock you in your room?
I just went out for a walk.
At 2 o' clock in the morning? You went out for a walk?

[Deena's mother walks down the stairwell]
When your grounded?
I've been locked up all day!
You haven't been locked up all day! But you will be, I'll nail the damn door shut if I have to!
You're not leaving this house until we get you to a doctor.
A doctor?
It's for your own good Deena. Whatever is going on has to stop and it's gonna stop now.
[Deena grabs a telephone and starts swinging it]
We try to help you.
Get away from me!
Put that down!
[Deena continues to swing the telephone]
Deena, put that down, right now!
Get away!
Put the damn phone down!
Get away from me!
Deena, stop it!
[Deena slowly backs up and some pictures are behind her]
What the hell are you doing? Deena!
[Deena hits her mother in the face with the telephone]
Deena! Deena, come back here! Deena!

You're being charged with assault, too. That's a felony. It's a very serious charge. Since this is your first offense, I don't want to keep you in detention. But the situation has your home is far too volatile for me to send you back until the cases resolved.
Uh, Your Honor, if I can say something. I don't think Deena was trying to hit her mother with a telephone. I think she was just trying to...
I don't want to hear about that now. I'm only interested whether I should keep Deena in detention until the dispo hearing. Are there any alternative placement available?
Uh, Your Honor, I spoke with Deena this morning. And she informed me that if she can't go home, she has an aunt she like to stay with.
But she wants to come home.
I can't allow that.
[Todd whispering in Cynthia's ear]
Look, let's just get her out. And we're worry about the rest later, okay?
Do you have any objection to the aunt assuming that the probation officer approves?
No. No, Your Honor.

And in addition to the placement order, I want Deena to abide by whatever guidelines the probation officer sets forth and begin counseling immediately. Now within my power, I ordered the entire family into therapy. But I can't do that. What I can do is mandate that between now and the dispo hearing, you'll see your daughter only in the presence of a therapist approved by this court.

[Judge Roubal is addressing to Deena Marten in court before making the ruling]
I could send you to jail for 6 months, Deena. But since this is your first offense, and since I have some very good reports from your therapist, I'm going to allow you to go home. But I'm also placing you on probation for 1 year, provided that you perform 300 hours of Community Service, that you attend anger management classes, and that you abide by whatever addition guidelines your probation officer deems appropriate. I have high hopes for you, Deena. I've seen too many kids fall by the wayside because they did not have the support of their families. You've got that. So don't let me see you back here again.
[Deena listen and accept Judge Roubal's warning. Deena smiles]
Thank you.
I don't know what we're do. We tried everything. She's out of control, she breaks things, she hits her mother.
May I have your hand?
Uh, that was an accident. Look, if you can just get that knife away from her, calm her down, I'm sure we can.
[the policeman caught and bring Deena downstairs. The Police Officer is writing a report. But Todd is here and have found her]
We're taking you to the hospital.
No, you're not. She's under arrest.
Arrest, for what?
Assault.
Uh, now, wait a minute, wait a minute. We don't want this.
You can't arrest her.
Take her out.
You can't do that.
Now, wait a minute, wait a minute. We didn't ask for this. We didn't call the police.
I did.
[Cynthia and Todd turned to his son Adam, sitting at the piano]
It was your idea. At the hospital, you said that...
I didn't say you should call the police...
[the police officer hands over the list of police warning to Todd]
Here. You'll see the warning. Just tell you what to do.
